hypothesis_content.title: Mysterious Trader Flow Exhaustion Timing
hypothesis_content.statement: When 'mysterious trader' selling narratives emerge during neutral regimes and price declines 2-4% on elevated volume, entering long positions after the third consecutive 4-hour candle of declining volume (while price stabilizes) captures the exhaustion of informed selling pressure.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Informed trader narratives create self-fulfilling prophecies as others front-run the expected move. Once volume declines while price stabilizes, it suggests the 'mysterious' flow has exhausted. Negative funding during decline indicates excessive pessimism that can reverse sharply.
entry_conditions: Specific 'informed trader' narrative in news (e.g., 'mysterious traders selling')
Three consecutive 4-hour candles show declining volume (each < previous)
Price range of third candle < 50% of first candle's range
Funding rates turn negative during decline

exit_conditions.take_profit: Return to pre-narrative price levels OR 5% gain
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Break below third candle's low by 1.5%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 50% of such volume-exhaustion patterns lead to further declines >2% within 48 hours across 30+ historical 'informed flow' narratives.
